thread.title: Go Zero G with Tom Cruise in a Mummy Behind-the-Scenes Clip
thread.title_full: Go Zero G with Tom Cruise in a Mummy Behind-the-Scenes Clip

author: CS
title: Go Zero G with Tom Cruise in a Mummy Behind-the-Scenes Clip
text:
SHARE Go Zero G with Tom Cruise in a Mummy behind-the-scenes clip 
At the South by Southwest Film Festival , Universal Pictures and IMAX teamed up for The Mummy Zero Gravity VR Experience , which transported attendees to the set of The Mummy , alongside stars Tom Cruise and Annabelle Wallis as they performed the thrilling stunt in Zero G four miles above sea level. You can now go behind the scenes with the clip below! 
Tom Cruise headlines a spectacular, all-new cinematic version of the legend that has fascinated cultures all over the world since the dawn of civilization: The Mummy . 
Thought safely entombed in a crypt deep beneath the unforgiving desert, an ancient queen (Sofia Boutella of Kingsman: The Secret Service and Star Trek Beyond ) whose destiny was unjustly taken from her, is awakened in our current day, bringing with her malevolence grown over millennia and terrors that defy human comprehension. 
From the sweeping sands of the Middle East through hidden labyrinths under modern-day London, The Mummy brings a surprising intensity and balance of wonder and thrills in an imaginative new take that ushers in a new world of gods and monsters. 
Cruise is joined by a cast including Annabelle Wallis (upcoming King Arthur , television’s Peaky Blinders ), Jake Johnson ( Jurassic World ), Courtney B. Vance (TV’s American Crime Story: The People V. O.J. Simpson ) and Oscar winner Russell Crowe ( Gladiator ). 
Coming to theaters on June 9, 2017, The Mummy is directed by Alex Kurtzman, who also produces alongside Chris Morgan ( Fast & Furious series, Wanted ) and Sean Daniel ( The Mummy trilogy, The Best Man series). Jon Spaihts and Christopher McQuarrie wrote the screenplay, and Bobby Cohen executive produces. It’s being planned as the first film in the Universal Monster cinematic universe with plans for The Wolfman, The Invisible Man , Bride of Frankenstein , and Van Helsing all in various stages of development.
